title: Augusta County: Clinton Hatcher to Mary Anna Sibert, June 21, 1861
summary: Clinton Hatcher describes camp life, conveys his anxiousness to meet the Yankee abolitionists in battle, and criticizes men too cowardly to defend their women. He encourages Mary Sibert in her discussions on national affairs and comments on the nature of her sex, including her rumored flirtatiousness and heartlessness.
keywords: Camp Life, Enlistment, Military Authority, Patriotism, Slavery, Women, American Civil War
